titles.title: To amend title 51, United States Code, to provide for licenses and experimental permits for space support vehicles, and for other purposes.
Commercial Space Support Vehicle Act
Commercial Space Support Vehicle Act

Commercial Space Support Vehicle Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Science, Space, and Technology.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology. H. Rept. 115-789.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 611.

action.text: Mr. Posey moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5346.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

bill.summary:
Commercial Space Support Vehicle Act
This bill authorizes the Department of Transportation to issue licenses or permits for flights of a space support vehicle that are not a launch or reentry. Such a vehicle may be a launch vehicle, reentry vehicle, or a component of a launch or reentry vehicle.
